Rules for radicals by Saul Alinsky. 
* power is what you have and what people think you have
* keep within the exerptise of your people
* go outside the exerptise of your enemy
* force the enemy to live up to its own rules
* ridicule your enemy
* use tactics your people enjoy
* don't use tactis that drag on too long
* keep the pressure on
* threat is often more potent then the thing itself
* develop tactics that will operationally keep pressure on the opposition
* pushing negative hard and long enough leads to a positive
* the cost of success is a an adaptive counterattack or novel defense by the enemy
* pick a target, freeze it, personalize it and polarize it
